name: Banpresto Dragon Ball Ichiban Kuji Ex The Fierce Men Of Turtle Hermit School Japanese Lottery
description:
Chiban Kuji, Meaning ´´Lottery Number 1´´, Is A Limited-Run Lottery System Created By Bandai.

Important:

Each Ticket Is Recommended To Sell At 15 A Rrp.

The Prize Considered As ´´Last One´´ Or Last Prize, Is Delivered Only After The Last Ticket Sold And Is Not Counted In The Batch Of Items But Is Additional.

This Kuji Has A Total Of 80 Prizes, Not Counting The Last One And Has A Good Number Of Figures Of All Kinds And Other Incredible Prizes.

In This Type Of Lottery The Prizes Vary.

But The Greatest Prize Is The Last Prize.

What Are The Ichibansho Figures.

These Figures Are 6 Inch Tall Figures, Sometimes Larger, And Are Great For Any Fan Of The Series.

Also Note That These Giveaways Are Released In Series, So There Are No Mixed Series In The Giveaway.

Ichiban Kuji is a Japanese tombola or lottery held in shops where you have to buy a ticket to participate.

When you tear the ticket you will get a letter that corresponds to one of the prizes.

We are offering the full set of prizes without the need for lotteries or tickets.
